intro: Baillieria commelinoides, commonly known as the slender spikerush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spike-like inflorescences. It often grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
